primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God seeks and creates true beauty (kingly character) in a human subject through the Holy Spirit, ultimately fulfilled in Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have chosen one of his sons
The Lord looks at the heart
God always chooses people like that
He always chooses the girl nobody wants
the secret of both detecting and developing true beauty

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of values and the Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully upon David
so you and I could have the only beauty that matters
if we believe in him, God looks at us and sees us in him

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Jesus Christ (on the cross)
tekstueel_bewijs: the gift of the Holy Spirit
Jesus Christ crucified is... true wisdom and true power
He lost all of his beauty... so you and I could have the only beauty that matters
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Trinitarian agency)

tegenstander.identificatie: The World's Values / Superficiality / Satan / Mortality
tekstueel_bewijs: hunted not by Saul but by Satan
the cultural intense emphasis on beauty
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'world system' and 'Satan' that invert God's values and lead to death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer develops inner beauty (sanctification) as a response to the Gospel.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly stated as impossible without the primary program (Spirit/Gospel).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God always chooses the son everybody forgot
He emptied himself of his beauty
God looks at us and sees us in him
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Jesse had seven of his sons pass
You’re going to need a lot more than that

voorbeelden: we shouldn’t be enamored with the external
we want beauty because it reminds us of youth
the secret to detecting and developing true beauty
the real problem is we basically know how we ought to live. We just can’t do it.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human lack of 'Pouvoir' (ability) and God's provision of it through the Spirit and the Cross.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (cultural obsession) to ~S1 (failed self-effort) to S1 (Christ's beauty on the cross).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ 'losing his beauty' (S2) to grant us 'true beauty' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; external beauty is linked to mortality and the fear of death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects self-effort ('you’re going to need a lot more than that') and centers on the substitutionary work of Christ.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: David has to get the Holy Spirit if he’s going to become a true king.
He lost all of his beauty so you and I could have the only beauty that matters.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is used as a type of Christ or a recipient of grace, not a moral hero to imitate by will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God chooses the 'runt' to show His power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from cultural pressure; empowerment through identity in Christ.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace alone precedes and enables sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative moves seamlessly from the 1 Samuel text to contemporary culture to the Cross.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He lost all of his beauty so you and I could have the only beauty that matters.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is seen as an inability to be good despite knowing the good.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains God as the primary Subject. The 'Object' of beauty is correctly identified as a gift rather than a human achievement.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as cultural idolatry and death.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching that uses structural analysis to dismantle cultural idols.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'mirror' illustration; semiotics focuses on God as the active Subject of the verb 'to choose'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'runt' (smallest); semiotics explains why the 'runt' must be the Receiver and God the Subject for the story to function as Gospel.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch' where David's incompetence is met by the Spirit's competence.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Be like David' trap by emphasizing David's passivity in the anointing.
